intro: Racosperma estrophiolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
